bug.author: durch
bug.summary: no matches for kind "Profile" in version "kubeflow.org/v1alpha1"
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: Deploying kubeflow to a new aks-engine k8s cluster. kfctl init and kfctl generate all complete successfully, kfctl apply all throws: <denchmark-code>couldn't apply KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Apply failed for kustomize: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't create default profile from &{{Profile kubeflow.org/v1alpha1} {kubeflow-anonymous 0 0001-01-01 00:00:00 +0000 UTC <nil> <nil> map[] map[] [] nil [] } {{User anonymous }} { }} Error: no matches for kind "Profile" in version "kubeflow.org/v1alpha1" </denchmark-code>
What did you expect to happen: Kubeflow to be deployed Environment:
kfctl version: v0.6.2 Kubernetes platform: aks-engine Kubernetes version:
<denchmark-code>Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"15", GitVersion:"v1.15.3", GitCommit:"2d3c76f9091b6bec110a5e63777c332469e0cba2", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-08-19T12:36:28Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.9", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"} Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"12", GitVersion:"v1.12.8", GitCommit:"a89f8c11a5f4f132503edbc4918c98518fd504e3", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-04-23T04:41:47Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.8", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} </denchmark-code>
OS: Ubuntu 16.04.6 LTS

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.98. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/durch>@durch</denchmark-link> I can reproduce the same issue. As a temporary workaround, I have tested that using following config for the init works in AKS: <denchmark-code>kfctl init ${KFAPP} --config https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/v0.6.2/bootstrap/config/kfctl_k8s_istio.0.6.2.yaml </denchmark-code>
More details about this installation option from <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/</denchmark-link> . In my opinion, it would be a good idea to keep this issue open until running kfctl without any config flag works. I wonder would above configuration be a good default or what is the expected result without user-defined config?

Thank you <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vjrantal>@vjrantal</denchmark-link> I can confirm that this fixes the problem, I'd sure take the above as default, or at least update the docs so that its clear that a config needs to be passed in and is not magically inferred from the version.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/durch>@durch</denchmark-link> Today, my PR was merged and this is now included in the docs at <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/azure/deploy/install-kubeflow/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/azure/deploy/install-kubeflow/</denchmark-link> .

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/durch>@durch</denchmark-link> You are correct --config needs to be provided. Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vjrantal>@vjrantal</denchmark-link> ; I'm going to close this since it looks like your PR fixed this issue.
